intro: Erysimum sorgerae, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada wallflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of California. It features erect, hairy stems and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with four petals. The plant has lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, typically growing in rocky or gravelly habitats. Erysimum sorgerae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in alpine meadows.
